Articles.Content:
What will you be working on now that life support has been added?

Secret project

Nice.

I'm gonna give it a shot and try to add food or water to the Mir Station.
first we release ECLSS for stock parts
So Bobcat are you gona do the constellation program to mars like this one?:

Could you post it? It'd be great to have this feature.

1. Install the RealChute Parachute Mod Mod.

2. Replace part.cfg below with GameData\BobCatind\SovietPack\Parts\Buran\Buran_parachute\part.cfg

http://www./download/h685h5nxos56131/part.cfg

Edited November 13, 2013 by jrolson

So Bobcat are you gona do the constellation program to mars like this one?

Yes, but now we work in secret project.
nice!!! looking forward to it

first we release ECLSS for stock parts

I was about to start rebuilding my main spacestation...but it looks like I am gonna hold off on that a bit longer...because my station needs those parts! They look great!
Is there a thread explaining what ECLSS is? I am confused.

Yes, but now we work in secret project.

Awesome! Keep up the good work. You sir are amazing.
anyone else having trouble using hyperedit with life support? it crashes when i try to return to the spaceport and my save gets corrupted

anyone else having trouble using hyperedit with life support? it crashes when i try to return to the spaceport and my save gets corrupted

Just delete LifeSupport directory. And I think someone mentioned there's a path for LifeSupport a few pages back.

Ok, guys, like it usually happens, I've found a serious bug that could hang KSP. You can get a hotfix here: https://bitbucket.org/asmi/ksp/downloads/LifeSupportMod.1.0.1.zip To install, unpack it inside GameData folder.

BobCat - please update the version in your pack.

This Hotfix bogs down my system like crazy, what changes were made to this from the original?

anyone else having trouble using hyperedit with life support? it crashes when i try to return to the spaceport and my save gets corrupted

I was having that issue but without Hyperedit. The patch posted by asmi fixed it on my pc.

I was having that issue but without Hyperedit. The patch posted by asmi fixed it on my pc.

You didn't find that it slowed down your performance at all? It's making my install cringe, and I barely have anything mods-wise.

You didn't find that it slowed down your performance at all? It's making my install cringe, and I barely have anything mods-wise.

I did notice a bit of a performance hit, still playable but noticeable. TBH though I installed a few things and hadn't worked out what the cause was yet.

Is anyone having issues with the craft files they seem to either stop the load button working or they are missing something I deleted all the old ones and add the new ones with the pack. I see a clean install in my future happening
Craft files loading just fine for me.

Which parts of the Russian pack uses KAS?

And why?

Which parts of the Russian pack uses KAS?

And why?

Some of the parts have container space now, for parts. Past that I haven't seen anything else using it, but haven't really looked.

To everybody who has some problems:

Since my very own remote mind reader is on vacation, I can't know what's going on on your computers unless you provide me a log file!

Which parts of the Russian pack uses KAS?

And why?

The top solar panel on the Mir core module and the kvant solar panels can be moved
How to install the ECLSS?

There are 5 parts in the Soviet pack that require KAS. 2 items allow grabbing the part and moving it during EVA and 3 are storage containers so you can bring more items up to the station/craft/whatever. Here are those parts:

  • Parts\MIR\MIR_core_solar_top\part.cfg (1 hit)
    Line 62: name = KASModuleGrab
  • Parts\MIR\MIR_KVANT_core\part.cfg (1 hit)
    Line 101: name = KASModuleContainer
  • Parts\MIR\MIR_KVANT_core_solar\part.cfg (1 hit)
    Line 61: name = KASModuleGrab
  • Parts\N1L3\Soyuz_LK_pod\part.cfg (1 hit)
    Line 153: name = KASModuleContainer
  • Parts\Soyuz\Soyuz_Orbital_module\part.cfg (1 hit)
    Line 82: name = KASModuleContainer

How to install the ECLSS?

Install the 'Life Support' folder included along with either pack in the same fashion.
